page.title: 05NURSTED FARM
page.content: Total area 332 acres.{ {Crops:}Their crop rotation involves oats, wheat, barley, turnips, sheep and pasture. The turnips are sown after the barley to crop in the same year. The sheep will then graze on the turnips and fertilize the ground in preparation for pastures. The wheat and barley are sold, some of the barley is sent for malting and the oats are sold to eventually become breakfast cereal.{ Livestock:}About 360 mules (a cross between Border Leicester/Swaledale) are reared. 25-40 heifers are reared in summer only. { {Mechanisation:}3 members of the farmer's family run the farm. 3 tractors and 1 combine harvester are based at the farm. Additional sewage from the Petersfield Sewage Farm is used. The E.E.C. has helped finance a land drainage scheme.
